ETYMOLOGY: From Arabic مُسْلِم (muslim), the active participle of أَسْلَمَ (ʾaslama, 'to submit'), meaning 'one who submits' (to God/Allah). The spelling 'Moslem' (used in the user input) is an archaic variant.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who follows the religion of Islam; a believer in the tenets of Islam.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 伊斯兰教的信徒；穆斯林。其字面意思为“顺服者”（顺服真主）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She converted to Islam and became a practicing Muslim.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她皈依了伊斯兰教，成为了一名虔诚的穆斯林。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Relating to or characteristic of Islam or its followers.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The Muslim world spans many countries and cultures.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 穆斯林世界横跨许多国家和文化。

REGISTER: Standard English. Note: The spelling 'Moslem' is now generally avoided in favor of 'Muslim'.
